feed.title: Google Cloud: Migrate to Virtual Machines
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Migrate to Virtual Machines

entry.content: Generally available: The Basic Input/Output System (BIOS) to Unified Extensible Firmware Interface (UEFI) conversion option is now generally available. Migrate to Virtual Machines lets you convert the OS boot type of a VM instance from BIOS to UEFI. This option is useful when you want to securely boot your VM instance, as secure boot is only supported by UEFI. For more information, see the table in Configure the target for a migrated VM.
entry.summary: The conversion of BIOS to UEFI boot type for VM instances is now generally available. This feature is beneficial for enabling secure boot, which requires UEFI.
entry.title: Feature: BIOS to UEFI Conversion Now Available

entry.content: Starting with version Migrate Connector 2.7, throttling is supported for a second NIC.
entry.summary: Starting with version 2.7, the Migrate Connector supports throttling for a second network interface.
entry.title: Feature: Throttling Support for Second NIC in Migrate Connector
